sAUC
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • sAUC Example
  • News

Run semiparametric AUC regression model adjusting for categorical covariates

Ask for data frame that contains only required variables in the model, Request to define response and treatment group, convert variables other than response into factors, estimate model parameters, and display results.

sAUC(x = FALSE, treatment_group = FALSE, data = FALSE)

Arguments

x

A formula with response and covariates such as response ~ x1 + x2
treatment_group

A treatment group for which a comparision is to be made
data

A dataframe that contains only variables needed for the analysis. At this point, this dataframe should not contain any extra variables

Value

A list of model summary, coefficients, AUC details, and session information.

Examples

ds <- NULL
for (x1 in 0:1){
 for (x2 in 0:2){
   for (x3 in 0:2){
     for (group in 0:1){
         response <- round(rnorm(n = 100, mean = 0, sd = 1),4)
         column <- cbind(x1,x2,x3, group, response)
         ds <- as.data.frame(rbind(ds, column))
   }
  }
 }
}
ds[,c("x1", "x2", "x3", "group")] <- lapply(ds[,c("x1", "x2", "x3", "group")],
                                          function(x) factor(x))

sAUC(x = response ~ x1 + x2 + x3, treatment_group = "group", data = ds)
